content.raw:
@{557058:c8cb9f24-90aa-4ffe-ac4f-4da0589ec56f}, did you use give a custom name to your robots when you launched your simulation? On your initial post you listed `robotName1:=X1`, but this issue has pivoted so much already that I'm not sure that's still your setup.

It looks like the joystick teleoperation isn't supposed to support custom robot names, it's just meant for debugging a few robots at a time. So could you try launching with `robotName1:=X1` and see if that fixes your joystick issue?

---

If you really want to use custom names, you can build `subt_examples` from source, changing the [config](#!/osrf/subt/src/default/subt_example/config/robot_config.yaml) file to match your robot's name, i.e.

```.diff
+++ b/subt_example/config/robot_config.yaml     Sat Jul 27 16:19:22 2019 -0700
@@ -1,11 +1,11 @@
 robot_names:
-  - X1
+  - X1_C1
   - X2
   - X3
   - X4
 
 button_robot_map:
-  A: X1
+  A: X1_C1
   B: X2
   X: X3
   Y: X4
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@
   - /right_flashlight/enable
 
 robot_address_map:
-  X1: X1
+  X1: X1_C1
   X2: X2
   X3: X3
   X4: X4
```
content.html:
@Lý Nguyễn, did you use give a custom name to your robots when you launched your simulation? On your initial post you listed robotName1:=X1, but this issue has pivoted so much already that I'm not sure that's still your setup.

It looks like the joystick teleoperation isn't supposed to support custom robot names, it's just meant for debugging a few robots at a time. So could you try launching with robotName1:=X1 and see if that fixes your joystick issue?

If you really want to use custom names, you can build subt_examples from source, changing the config file to match your robot's name, i.e.

+++ b/subt_example/config/robot_config.yaml     Sat Jul 27 16:19:22 2019 -0700
@@ -1,11 +1,11 @@
 robot_names:
-  - X1
+  - X1_C1
   - X2
   - X3
   - X4

 button_robot_map:
-  A: X1
+  A: X1_C1
   B: X2
   X: X3
   Y: X4
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@
   - /right_flashlight/enable

 robot_address_map:
-  X1: X1
+  X1: X1_C1
   X2: X2
   X3: X3
   X4: X4
